donor_name: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
outputs.output_descr:
Goal: To reduce the malaria incidence rate from 10.6% to 6.5% of the population by 2014.
Target Group/Beneficiaries: Communities in the districts where malaria occurs.
Strategies:
Prompt and effective anti-malaria treatment, enhanced case detection, strengthened home-based management of malaria and strengthened monitoring of drag resistance.
Planned activities:
Increase coverage of households in malaria endemic areas by IRS, at least 90% of malaria cases managed according to the national treatment guidelines, increased and better detection and case management through training of health workers and community awareness generation, resource mobilization and capacity building at the district level to rapidly detect and respond to malaria epidemics, strengthen management of the National Malaria Program through capacity building.

project_descr: Round 8 Malaria Grant: Towards universal access: Scaling up effective malaria control interventions in Zimbabwe
project_title: Scaling up effective malaria control interventions
